title: Fact Check: Mitt Romney Did NOT Endorse Joe Biden | Lead Stories
subtitle: Did Mitt Romney endorse Joe Biden for president of the United States? No, that's not true. The story was published...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Did Mitt Romney endorse Joe Biden for president of the United States? No, that's not true. The story was published by a liberal satire website that tries to mislead Trump supporters and Republicans into sharing made-up stories that are clearly marked as satire when you actually click them. Articles from the site are frequently copied by foreign-run fake news websites. The people liking and sharing these stories are enriching foreign website operators or a liberal from Maine via the ad revenue generated with the content, which is probably not what they expected or wanted.

The claim originated as an article published by DailyWorldUpdate.us on April 20, 2020, titled "Romney Endorses Joe Biden" (archived here). It opened:

After his unsuccessful run for President against Barack Obama, Mitt Romney hasn't exactly acted like the Republican's Republican. He's voted against several pieces of GOP legislation while representing the state of Utah in the Senate, and he was the only voice of the conservative right to correctly recommend that Donald Trump be charged and prosecuted for crimes during his historic impeachment trial. Now, however, his seemingly turncoat antics may have gone too far. Like someone giving Melania Trump an American Express Gold Card at the Bunny Ranch. Just this morning, at the Brigham Young pagoda of Utah's Sandy Batt Fellowship Hall, the Informin' Mormon told a gathered press corps that he would be endorsing candidate Joe Biden for the 2020 Presidential election over incumbent and fellow Republican Donald Trump.

But the story was posted in a category named "Deep State fan Fiction for the Derp State," and there were several other hints and disclaimers on the page explaining the whole thing was fiction, such as the site header that read "Satire for Flat Earthers, Trumpsters and Y'all Qaeda."

There are no media reports about a Romney endorsement for Biden and Romney's own website also makes no mention of it.

Despite being totally made up, the fictional story racked up over 30,000 engagements on Facebook at the time of this writing, with many people angrily commenting on it -- all while seemingly being unaware that the story was not real.

DailyWorldUpdate.us is part of the "America's Last Line of Defense" network of satire websites run by self-professed liberal troll Christopher Blair from Maine, along with a loose confederation of friends and allies. Blair has been in a feud with fact-checking website Snopes for some time now and has also criticized other fact checkers in the past who labeled his work "fake news" instead of satire. In reaction to this, he has rebranded all his active websites and Facebook pages so they carry visible disclaimers everywhere.

Every site in the network has an about page that reads (in part):

About Satire

Before you complain and decide satire is synonymous with "comedy": sat·ire

ˈsaˌtī(ə)r

noun

The use of humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues. Everything on this website is fiction. It is not a lie and it is not fake news because it is not real. If you believe that it is real, you should have your head examined. Any similarities between this site's pure fantasy and actual people, places, and events are purely coincidental and all images should be considered altered and satirical. See above if you're still having an issue with that satire thing.

Articles from Blair's sites frequently get copied by "real" fake news sites that often omit the satire disclaimer and any other hints the stories are fake. Blair has tried to get these sites shut down in the past, but new ones keep cropping up.
